remarks: Link congruence over a pair of line segments.  Theorem 2.11 of [Schwabhauser] p. 29.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 23-Mar-2019.)
statement:
tkgeom.p $e |- P = ( Base ` G ) $.
tkgeom.d $e |- .- = ( dist ` G ) $.
tkgeom.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
tkgeom.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
tgcgrextend.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. P ) $.
tgcgrextend.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. P ) $.
tgcgrextend.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. P ) $.
tgcgrextend.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. P ) $.
tgcgrextend.e $e |- ( ph -> E e. P ) $.
tgcgrextend.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. P ) $.
tgcgrextend.1 $e |- ( ph -> B e. ( A I C ) ) $.
tgcgrextend.2 $e |- ( ph -> E e. ( D I F ) ) $.
tgcgrextend.3 $e |- ( ph -> ( A .- B ) = ( D .- E ) ) $.
tgcgrextend.4 $e |- ( ph -> ( B .- C ) = ( E .- F ) ) $.
tgcgrextend $p |- ( ph -> ( A .- C ) = ( D .- F ) ) $.
